required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to use a new method of high-density electroencephalogram (HD-EEG) recording to map brain areas important for movement, sensation, language, emotion, and cognition.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will measure brain waves using high-density EEG. Participants will be asked wear a cap with electrodes attached to it. During the recording, participants may be asked to rest, sleep, or complete a task. The tasks involve viewing pictures, answering questions, speaking, or moving an arm or leg. Recordings generally last between 60-120 minutes.*

primary_outcome.measure: Localize brain functions in patients and healthy controls
primary_outcome.description: Localize brain functions using high-density EEG recordings

secondary_outcome.measure: Localize brain areas involved in language
secondary_outcome.description: Localize brain areas involved in language using high-density EEG recordings

secondary_outcome.measure: Localize brain areas involved in movement
secondary_outcome.description: Localize brain areas involved in movement using high-density EEG recordings

secondary_outcome.measure: Localize brain areas involved in sensation
secondary_outcome.description: Localize brain areas involved in sensation using high-density EEG recordings

secondary_outcome.measure: Localize brain areas involved in emotion
secondary_outcome.description: Localize brain areas involved in emotion using high-density EEG recordings

secondary_outcome.measure: Localize brain areas involved in memory
secondary_outcome.description: Localize brain areas involved in memory using high-density EEG recordings

secondary_outcome.measure: Localize brain areas associated with lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Localize brain areas associated with lesions using high-density EEG recordings

arm_group.description: High-density EEG will be used for brain localization in epilepsy patients

arm_group.arm_group_label: High-density EEG localization in healthy controls
arm_group.description: High-density EEG will be used for brain localization in healthy controls

arm_group.arm_group_label: High-density EEG localization in tumor patients
arm_group.description: High-density EEG will be used for brain localization in tumor patients

arm_group.arm_group_label: High-density EEG localization in peripheral nerve patients
arm_group.description: High-density EEG will be used for brain localization in patients with peripheral nerve dysfunction

intervention.description: This study will focus on obtaining a special type of high-density scalp electroencephalography (HD-EEG) recordings in patients with neurological disorders (i.e., epilepsy, brain tumor, stroke, etc.) and appropriately matched controls. HD-EEG is a scalp EEG which uses up to 256 channels compared to the standard 21 channels used for routine clinical applications. The reason for using more channels to record is for more precise localization of epileptogenic foci and/or more precise mapping of brain functions. This type of EEG requires the use of patient's own MRI scan to precisely localize activity. Therefore, all patients and controls getting an HD-EEG will require a structural MRI scan.
intervention.arm_group_label: High-density EEG localization in healthy controls
High-density EEG localization in peripheral nerve patients
High-density EEG localization in tumor patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to perform the tasks
- Able to give own consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any neurologic or psychiatric diagnosis such as stroke, tumor, or psychosis judged to interfere with high-density EEG.
